responses.rationale: Reports numerical metrics ('5.3 million hens and 88,000 turkeys') using standard verbs ('forcing the killing').
Reports numerical metrics ('about 22 million birds', '1.8 million broiler chickens', etc.) using standard verbs ('have had to kill').
Reports numerical metrics ('about 13 million chickens and 305,000 turkeys') using standard verbs ('having to kill').
Reports numerical metrics ('46 million chickens') using standard verbs ('had').
Reports numerical metrics ('about 11.7 million turkeys annually') using standard verbs ('raises').
The segment reports locations of cases, not primarily prices, economic data, or numerical metrics in the Q9 sense.
Reports confirmation of a case on a specific farm with a bird count, not primarily aggregate metrics or economic data.
Reports numerical metrics ('23 states have confirmed cases') using standard verbs ('shows', 'have confirmed').
The segment explains the cause of spread, not primarily prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
Reports a numerical metric ('56 percent of bird flu cases detected in humans were fatal') using a standard verb ('reported').
Reports a numerical metric ('one in five milk samples') using standard verbs ('announced', 'had').
Reports numerical metrics ('at least one person', '36 dairy herds') using standard verbs ('confirmed', 'have been confirmed').
Reports corrections to numerical metrics ('total number of birds killed... at 22 million', 'in Iowa to 13 million') using standard verbs ('updated', 'correct').
Reports corrections to numerical metrics ('total number of birds killed... to 22 million', 'in Iowa to 13 million') using standard verbs ('updated', 'correct').
Reports numerical metrics ('at least 26 states', 'nearly a year') using standard verbs ('have been found', 'has been circulating').
